title: A Cry for Deliverance
shortSummary: Psalm 69 is a heartfelt plea from David for God's rescue amid overwhelming distress and persecution. The psalm vividly portrays deep anguish, wrongful suffering, and confident trust in God's mercy and salvation. It also anticipates the vindication of the righteous and the judgment of enemies.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The psalmist and king of Israel, expressing his deep anguish and trust in God during times of persecution and distress.

keyCharacters.name: Enemies of David
keyCharacters.description: Those who hate and wrongfully persecute David, representing opposition to God's anointed.

definitions.definition: A Hebrew term meaning 'lilies,' likely referring to a musical tune or style for which this psalm was to be performed.
A coarse, rough garment worn as a sign of mourning, repentance, or distress.
A bitter substance used metaphorically here to represent bitterness or suffering inflicted by enemies.
A biblical metaphor for the record of those who are alive and righteous before God.

outline.heading: David’s Desperate Plea for Help
outline.description: David cries out to God for salvation as he feels overwhelmed by troubles likened to deep waters and mire, acknowledging his own sins and foolishness.

outline.heading: Suffering for God’s Sake
outline.description: David describes the reproach and alienation he endures because of his zeal for God, highlighting the loneliness and scorn he faces from his own people.

outline.heading: Prayer for Mercy and Deliverance
outline.description: In humble prayer, David appeals to God’s lovingkindness and mercy, asking for swift deliverance from his enemies and the overwhelming dangers surrounding him.

outline.heading: Imprecatory Prayers Against Enemies
outline.description: David recounts the pain caused by his adversaries and calls upon God to bring judgment upon them, asking that their plans be thwarted and that they be excluded from righteousness.

outline.heading: Praise and Assurance of Salvation
outline.description: Despite his affliction, David commits to praising God, confident that the Lord hears the poor and will save Zion, ensuring a future inheritance for His servants.

application: In times of overwhelming distress, bring your burdens honestly before God, trusting in His mercy and salvation.
Remain faithful and zealous for God even when facing reproach, alienation, or misunderstanding from others.
Pray earnestly for deliverance from enemies and trials, knowing God hears the cries of the humble and afflicted.
Respond to suffering with praise and thanksgiving, confident that God will ultimately vindicate and establish His people.

keyVerses.text: Save me, O God; for the waters are come in unto my soul.
keyVerses.significance: This opening verse powerfully expresses the psalmist’s urgent need for God’s rescue amid overwhelming trouble.

keyVerses.text: For the zeal of thine house hath eaten me up; and the reproaches of them that reproached thee are fallen upon me.
keyVerses.significance: Highlights the psalmist’s suffering as a consequence of his passionate devotion to God’s honor.

keyVerses.text: Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness: and I looked for some to take pity, but there was none; and for comforters, but I found none.
keyVerses.significance: Conveys the deep loneliness and sorrow experienced by the righteous sufferer when abandoned by friends.

keyVerses.text: For the LORD heareth the poor, and despiseth not his prisoners.
keyVerses.significance: Assures believers that God attentively listens to the cries of the humble and those in distress.
